title: How to Play Plants VS Zombies on an iPod Touch

steps.headline: Collect sunshine.
steps.description: You start off each level with 50 sunshine to buy a sunflower, 2 sun mushrooms, or something else. Sunshine will fall out of the sky during day levels, but not night levels, where you will have to rely on sun-making plants. Each sunshine ray you collect gives you 25 sunshine points. Smaller sunshine rays will give you 15.

steps.headline: Buy plants with the sunshine.
steps.description: There are 49 plants in total. Some plants shoot projectiles, some explode, some give you sunshine, and some that protect or modify other plants.

steps.headline: Know about non-plant defense.
steps.description: For example, there are 5 lawnmowers on the path to the house. These will mow down zombies if they get past your plants, but they can only be used once. On pool or roof levels, there are other machines that can act as your last line of defense. These will only be able to be used once, and after that, zombies will be able to invade your home if they get past your plants. You can also buy a pack of mallets or rakes to knock out zombies with coins--however, these are one time use purchases.

steps.headline: When you complete the game you get Quick Mode where you can play levels.
You will start off with some plants.
steps.description: Make sure to water and fertilize them.

steps.headline: Buy plants in Crazy Dave's Shop or get them in levels.
Get new garden areas for 30,000 coins.
Be sure to care for your plants they give you coins!
Pea Shooter.
steps.description: Cost: 100 sunshine. Shoots peas at zombies (takes ten peas to kill a generic zombie).

steps.headline: Sunflower.
steps.description: Cost: 50 sunshine. Produces sunshine for sunlight points.

steps.headline: Potato Mine.
steps.description: Cost: 25 sunshine. After places, the Potato Mine will sit dormant for a little while, then will sprout and become active. When active, it will blow up and instantly kill any zombie that runs into it (with the exception of the Gargantuar and Dr. Zomboss).

steps.headline: Wallnut.
steps.description: Cost: 50 sunshine. Stands in the way of zombies. Zombies, unless they have an ability that allows them to do otherwise, will eat at the Wallnut until either the Wallnut is eventually eaten and disappears, or, more often, the zombie is destroyed.

text: Adventure mode Collect sunshine. You start off each level with 50 sunshine to buy a sunflower, 2 sun mushrooms, or something else. Sunshine will fall out of the sky during day levels, but not night levels, where you will have to rely on sun-making plants. Each sunshine ray you collect gives you 25 sunshine points. Smaller sunshine rays will give you 15. Buy plants with the sunshine. There are 49 plants in total. Some plants shoot projectiles, some explode, some give you sunshine, and some that protect or modify other plants. Know about non-plant defense. For example, there are 5 lawnmowers on the path to the house. These will mow down zombies if they get past your plants, but they can only be used once. On pool or roof levels, there are other machines that can act as your last line of defense. These will only be able to be used once, and after that, zombies will be able to invade your home if they get past your plants. You can also buy a pack of mallets or rakes to knock out zombies with coins--however, these are one time use purchases. When you complete the game you get Quick Mode where you can play levels.  Zen Garden You will start off with some plants. Make sure to water and fertilize them. Buy plants in Crazy Dave's Shop or get them in levels.  Get new garden areas for 30,000 coins.  Be sure to care for your plants they give you coins!  List of plants 4 basic plants. Pea Shooter. Cost: 100 sunshine. Shoots peas at zombies (takes ten peas to kill a generic zombie). Sunflower. Cost: 50 sunshine. Produces sunshine for sunlight points. Potato Mine. Cost: 25 sunshine. After places, the Potato Mine will sit dormant for a little while, then will sprout and become active. When active, it will blow up and instantly kill any zombie that runs into it (with the exception of the Gargantuar and Dr. Zomboss). Wallnut. Cost: 50 sunshine. Stands in the way of zombies. Zombies, unless they have an ability that allows them to do otherwise, will eat at the Wallnut until either the Wallnut is eventually eaten and disappears, or, more often, the zombie is destroyed.
